title: Senior Desktop Engineer
job_description: Delt is a brilliant contradiction. A dynamic and agile private sector company with a serious conscience, that’s wholly owned by the public sector. It’s somewhere you can do the right things for the right reasons while playing a real part in a growing business. In short – we help people do amazing things. We are seeking a skilled Senior Desktop Engineer to join our End User Computing team with enterprise level experience who can hit the ground running whilst embodying the Delt values. You’ll play an instrumental role in supporting our customers and shareholders whilst being given plenty of opportunity to better your skillset and take on new challenges through our dedication to employee development. The Senior Desktop Engineer will provide enterprise support to multiple large tenants at several sites across the Southwest. The role will involve managing and administering the technology and tools used to provision and support end user devices throughout their lifecycle. This role is hybrid working, with a realistic expectation to attend the Plymouth office once a week. Job Overview: As a Senior Desktop Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and supporting end user computing solutions for our clients. You will be responsible for ensuring the stability, security, and optimal performance of desktops, laptops, tables and mobile devices, as well as providing technical expertise to resolve complex issues. This position offers an exciting opportunity for a seasoned professional to contribute to the success of our projects and mentor junior team members. Responsibilities: Design, deploy, and maintain end user computing solutions.Provide advanced technical support.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and optimise products and solutions.Evaluate and recommend hardware and software solutions to meet business requirements.Conduct regular system audits for security and performance enhancements (automation).Mentor and guide junior desktop engineers.Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.Proven experience with device management technologies such as: Microsoft Configuration ManagerMicrosoft IntuneApple Business ManagerSamsung KnoxGoogle WorkspaceIvanti MobileIron Strong expertise in end user operating systems (Windows, Android, iOS) and applications.Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.Effective communication and interpersonal skills.Relevant certifications: Microsoft Certified (Windows 10, MCP, MCTS, etc.)ITIL v3 FoundationFull UK Driving License If this sounds like you, get in touch! What do you get? Being part of a highly technical and skilled teamWork in a flexible environmentOpportunities for working from homeMobile devices providedVaried training opportunities Applications will be considered on a rolling basis so please apply early, as we reserve the right to close the advert once we have sufficient quality applications

title: Senior Desktop Engineer
job_description: HDI Global is part of the Talanx Group, one of the world’s largest insurance groups and a leader in the delivery of global insurance solutions for corporate businesses. For over 100 years, HDI’s 3,000 employees around the world have offered a broad and needs-based range of insurance solutions and accompanying services to clients across a variety of industries. With a presence in over 150 territories, we are everywhere our clients need us to be. The Role The Senior Desktop Engineer delivers all IT Support and Service capabilities for HDI Global UK&I users, both onsite and virtually. Reporting directly to the Head of IT, the scope of this role includes ensuring the execution of IT support and operating standards that are required to support the HDI UK&I business. The ideal candidate will have experience providing Level 2 – Level 3 support. The role will require hands of experience with Microsoft Operating Systems and Applications (AD, Group Policies, Exchange, SharePoint, SQL), server and laptop hardware, virtualisation, desktop management, backup and recovery, networking and voice and data communications as well as troubleshooting for core business applications. Focus will be placed on internal customer facing technology systems, projects, and metrics, enabling our HDI user base within UK&I to work effectively. In addition, this role will act as a communication interface between the Business representatives and the IT teams in Germany to resolve issues with centrally provided systems. The aim will be for this role to become part of a global virtual support structure. The Responsibilities Support and Service Delivery:The position will require an engineer capable of building key relationships with end users, including VIP/Executives/Senior Management and their support staff.Troubleshooting of IT incidents.Providing 1st through to 3rd line support.Responsible for new hire IT inductions.Ensure high-level of availability of IT Services for all UK&I users.Build strong partnerships within and external to the immediate team.Ensure the maintenance and transfer of knowledge of IT systems in scope for UK&IDocument and maintain the services along with colleagues within the team and colleagues in Germany.Propose and implement new services that can improve user experience.Work closely with the Head of IT and Home Office to inform them of service disruption and the road to recovery.Conduct training session to promote new services and maintain a high-level of knowledge of HDI systems.Excellent verbal and written communications skills, including the ability to explain technical terms to non-technical users.Provide end-user awareness and training.Mentor junior members of staff and act as their escalation point. Incident and Request Management:Provide support for all incidents and service requests for all IT systems/services.Providing support in person, over the phone and using MS Teams.Ensure that incidents and requests are resolved in a timely manner.End to end ownership of all IT incidents and requests with responsibility for all communication and the technical resolution along with knowledge transfer to the Global Service Desk.Follow the escalation process to Germany where required to ensure a consistent and professional IT support service is offered.Manage all user administration tasks such as joiners, movers, and leavers. Operations Management:Deskside Asset management, support of Desktop PC's, Laptops, printers, and local hardware devices.Hardware/software procurement.Remote support for all UK & Ireland based colleagues.iPhone and iPad mobile device management and support.Manage and maintain IT Build room. Change and Configuration Management:Follow the change management process to ensure changes to the Desktop infrastructure follows the agreed process and do not cause unplanned outages.Work on assigned tasks associated with the Change process.Manage and maintain the accuracy of the Desktop infrastructure components held in the Configuration Management Database by following the agreed configuration management process. Project Management:As a Deskside Support Engineer, you may be involved in project work from inception through to transition to "business as usual" as the point of contact for the Deskside support team.Participate as a project resource as and when required to provide Deskside support input. The Requirements Required:Hands on Active Directory experience, ie, group policy objectsMicrosoft Windows 10 environmentO365 (MS Office, SharePoint, MS Teams, Edge)Knowledge of IT Infrastructures (DNS, DHCP)Hyper-V remote accessIBM hardware supportKnowledge on iPhones/iPadsGeneral knowledge of digital solutionsITIL Foundation and knowledge of Project Management practicesServiceNow Desirable:Azure admin or Exchange adminMS Server Admin and supportVEAM backup software supportPower BI scriptingSQL server support and maintenanceServiceNow highly desirable but not essential

title: Service Operations Director (1 year FTC)
job_description: Service Operations Director (1 year Fixed Term Contract)UK Based (Hybrid role - based in Shoreham or any of our offices across the country)Salary £80,000 - £100,000Starting February/March 2023Established in 2003, we're proud to be one of the UK's leading independent providers of essential business technology. The Service Operations Director role is responsible for a team of over 120 service professionals based in multiple sites across the UK. Ideally you will have successful experience automating service operations functions.The role involves: The implementation of a strategic initiative to integrate regional service operations into a single operating model, to optimise efficiency, business performance, and customer experience. Leveraging industry best practice in Process Improvement, Automation and to drive continued improvement and efficiency at scale.Assessing pipeline and demand against resource and capability to ensure contracted and business performance related objectives are met.Working with Subject Matter leaders and regional teams to design and implement best-practise processes for Operations. Ensuring those processes are subject to continuous review and improvement to meet evolving business strategy and requirements.Supporting the Chief Technology Officer with product evaluations, onboarding and lifecycle management.   Requirements  Essential Skills and ExperienceStrategic leadership - Visionary with excellent thought leadership and communication skills.Transformation - Excellent change agent, leading teams through significant change and development.Industry Expertise - Ability to critically evaluate performance, capability, and delivery strategy against peer organisations and with partners. Maintain an effective network of contacts and industry leaders.Team leadership - Inspiring leader, excellent motivation skills. Adept at creating and retaining talent.Customer Experience - Highly customer centric, engendering outstanding customer experience culture.Operational performance - Proven track record of delivering excellent service performance results.Data and Trend Analysis - Ability to use BI to refine performance and model strategy, identifying areas of risk, opportunity, and improvement.   Benefits  At Focus Group you can be proud of what you do, how you do it and feel a true part of the team. We work hard to create an inclusive, collaborative and rewarding environment where you are inspired to achieve brilliant things and really make a difference to the future of our business.We're proud to have built an outstanding place to work where people thrive and are recognised for their achievements. We're delighted to have been named one of the UK's best 100 Companies to Work for 2021 and a British Private Equity & Venture Capital Association (BVCA) 2023 Vision Award Winner for London & South East for our commitment to culture and ESG.We welcome all applications and if you struggle to apply online, please contact us for a chat, or email us directly. We can make any reasonable adjustments to the working environment to ensure all employees are included and can work safely in our offices

title: IT Helpdesk Manager
job_description: About Xerox Holdings Corporation  For more than 100 years, Xerox has continually redefined the workplace experience. Harnessing our leadership position in office and production print technology, we’ve expanded into software and services to sustainably power today’s workforce. From the office to industrial environments, our differentiated business solutions and financial services are designed to make every day work better for clients — no matter where that work is being done. Today, Xerox scientists and engineers are continuing our legacy of innovation with disruptive technologies in digital transformation, augmented reality, robotic process automation, additive manufacturing, Industrial Internet of Things and cleantech. Learn more at www.xerox.com and explore our commitment to diversity and inclusion.  About Xerox IT Services:  Xerox IT Services in the UK is part of the Global Xerox IT Services Team and serves the customers of Xerox Direct and its Acquired Companies in the UK.  We offer a comprehensive portfolio that includes Managed IT Services, Infrastructure and Networking, Data Centre deployment, Cloud services, End User Compute hardware and Security specialisms.  A team of 150 IT professionals make up the UK IT Services team.  Our vision is to continue to offer locally delivered and tailored IT Support and Professional Services engagements to our customers and grow our UK business both organically and through acquisition.  Job Summary:   The IT Helpdesk Desk Manager has overall responsibility for the IT service desk functions at ITEC including all customer incidents, problems, service requests and change requests.  The primary function of the role is to manage the day to day running of the customer service desk, in the office and in the field, ensuring customer requests are responded to in a polite and efficient manner and faults are resolved promptly or escalated as required.  Working with the Service Delivery Manager to develop the team structure in line with ITEC and customer needs, recruiting, training, coaching and mentoring staff as required.  The IT Helpdesk Desk Manager acts as a point of escalation for incidents so must have a broad range of technical knowledge with regards to IT infrastructure. Establishing inter-departmental and customer communication channels for high priority incidents is a key part of the role.  Working with Pre-Sales and the Sales teams to provide support on new business opportunities, the role is also responsible for managing the new client take-on process for the service desk.  Developing and building relationships with customers to retain business is a key part of the IT Helpdesk Desk Manager role. This is achieved via constant customer communication, responding to feedback, service review meetings and regular reporting.  For the benefit of ITEC, the IT Helpdesk Desk Manager must continuously gauge customer satisfaction and providing data and reports indicating performance against SLA and trend analysis to Senior Management.  Overall responsibility for the IT service desk function Customer incidents, problems, service requests and change requestsRecruiting, training, coaching and mentoring the service desk team leaders and technical support staffEscalation point for High Priority and Critical IncidentsManaging Service Desk ProcessesManaging the Service Desk ToolsetNew Customer Take-On ProcessBuilding and maintaining good relations with customersData and Reporting of KPIs  Key working relationships include:  Technical analysts and Technical Field AnalystsInfrastructure ManagerInfrastructure Technical SpecialistsIT Service Delivery ManagerAccount Managers and Account DirectorsCustomer contactsHR Department   General Responsibilities:  To support your colleagues, wherever practicable, to ensure they meet their objectivesTo support the Board of Directors and Management Team in delivering change that benefits the business as a wholeTo adhere to Itec’s Equal Opportunities policy in all activities, and to actively promote equality of opportunity wherever possible.To be responsible for your own health and safety and that of your colleagues, in accordance with the Health and Safety at Work Act (1974) and relevant EC directives. To work in accordance with the Data Protection Act and to ensure that all new systems are reported to your Data Protection Controller.To undertake such other duties as may be reasonably expected.To provide a healthy and comfortable working environment, smoking is prohibited throughout the company’s premises, except in specially designated areas.To work in accordance with our ISO27001 Information Security policies and procedures  Required Experience:  A high level understanding of IT and networks.Knowledge of desktop, server and printer hardware and their components Knowledge of network devices and their roles   Proficient in the use and support of:  Microsoft OfficeMicrosoft Windows clientMicrosoft Windows Server Active DirectoryDNS, DHCPMicrosoft Exchange Office 365Remote DesktopVMWare ESXi Email Relay and antispam Sonicwall routersDell / HP server and network hardwareAbility to plan, organize and adapt to changing job tasks within own role Open to respond to feedback and committed to self-development Team worker, ability to prioritise and delegate with strong leadership skillsExcellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills Strong analytical, logical and troubleshooting skills Strong verbal and written communication skillsService delivery management and methodologiesAt least 10 years’ experience working in a service desk environmentAt least 2 years’ experience in an IT or Service Desk Management roleITIL Service Management Foundation  Desired Experience:   Proficient in the use and support of:  Mac desktop OSXCitrix XenDesktop and XenServerVeeamSymantec Backup ExecVoIP telephony systems, in particular MitelSAN solutions and topologyITIL Practitioner and ManagerMicrosoft MCP, MCSA, MCSECitrix CCA, CCP, CCEVMWare VCA, VCP, VCAP, VCIX, VCDXHyperVIT related degreeMitel accreditationManaged Print Accreditations

title: Global IT Manager
job_description: Job OverviewThis is a stand alone role, leading and providing global IT support across our three offices (London, NYC, and New Orleans). The main objective being to ensure the smooth running of IT operations, supporting the business and it’s employees to work efficiently and effectively. Responsibilities Team Onboarding:Working with the People teams to ensure a smooth onboarding and offboarding process - allocating kit, ensuring all required logins are set upManaging and training for OnePasswordProviding an IT induction to all new joinersSoftware Management:Global managing of other systems, platforms and tools e.g. Monday.com, web hosting, cloudflare, etc. Including number of seats and costs.Responsibility for Google Drive - recommending the format and ways of working, full responsibility for access and sharing permissions.Continuous review of all tools in use to reduce duplication and cut unneeded spending.Hardware Management:Ordering new and refurbished kitOversight of hardware sell-offEnsure we always have a laptop/asset management doc along with details of warranties + management of ABM Security Management:Login/device management best practices (single sign-on etc, Gdpr and policies)Regularly review our IT policy to ensure it is kept up-to-date and relevant - in UK and USConducting regular system auditsIdentify vulnerabilities, recommend tools, and implement these to prevent future issuesEnsure our firewall kept up to date and is sufficient for our businessEnsure we maintain our Cyber Security status and upgrade/apply for other such standardsMaintenance of security controls, including firewalls and email compliance (i.e. onDMARC)Budget ManagementManaging and reporting on the allocation of IT budget Other:Helpdesk for all staff (although this requires minimum time due to the way we work)Ensuring all video conferencing kit is set up and functional in our meetings roomsSetting up al staff meetings - locally and globallyRunning and sharing regular operation system reports with senior staff when necessary (not happening but does need to be done)Implementation of SLEP policies for useful equipment (e.g. battery replacement on 2017 model MBPs with larger data capacity to continued use) Websites (BDB and IMC): Maintenance:Content updatesSite maintenanceURL, security and caching.Content updates + building of new contentFixing errors caused by other team members doing things without following the established process for site changesPS/AI work to create imagery for websites (when no creative is available or a time crunch.)URL management and procurement Other:Publication of new pages, posts, and review for SEO/visual consumption of new workMarketing:Paid media for Companion team + creation of all landing pages for both teamsSF integrations of URLs for sending of emails + mail merges with full DKIM/DMARC in order to prevent our urls from being classified as spam Strategic:Provide a written IT Strategy at the end of each year (for the following year) defining monthly projects both UK and USOverseeing and determining timeframes for major IT projects including system updates, upgrades, migrations and outagesIdentify problematic areas and implement strategic solutions in timeWork with Legal and BA team to identify vulnerabilities present in clients requested tools/workflows to ensure our compliance with other clients/governments/regulatory bodies.Identify and recommend blanket equipment “sunsetting” policies as items become unsupported or SLEP options for older equipment with viable service life as a fully functioning bit of kit after refurbishment, especially in conjunction with ESG/B CORP goals. Skills & Attributes At least 5 years solid IT experience, with some in a stand alone role.Experience of cloud based vs physical serversExperience with cyber security / anti-virus / backups?Experience of creating strategies, policies and proceduresGoogle Suite support and configurationExperience of supporting all hardware and software within a businessExcellent communication and organistions skillsProactive approach and problem solverMS qualification or networking qualificationSolid knowledge of networking protocols, firewalls, switches and wireless networks. About Billion Dollar Boy Billion Dollar Boy offers global data & insight, strategy, creative, production, paid media and end to end campaign management using industry leading proprietary software to deliver highly effective & efficient creator led advertising campaigns at scale. Since 2014, we have partnered with some of the world’s leading brands, including Heineken, King, Nintendo, PepsiCo, Campari Group, Primark, Shiseido, and L’Oreal. Our client campaigns have been awarded at the 2022 Cannes Lions, Influencer Marketing Awards, Webby Awards, The Drum Awards and Adweek. We were among the first global creator marketing agencies and we have evolved to be one of the world’s fastest-growing agencies, with offices in London, New York and New Orleans. We view creator marketing as a discipline, not an add-on - and bring this perspective into all of our agency offerings, proving the true value of influencer integration. Our people set us apart, and our vision is to set a new standard of advertising to change its culture for the better. We are also an official marketing partner of Meta, TikTok and YouTube. Our Culture Billion Dollar Boy is a hyper-caffeinated transatlantic creative agency with 100+ employees and counting in London, New York and New Orleans. We are actively creating campaigns across 7 continents with top brands spanning categories of beauty, fashion, lifestyle, consumer goods, food and beverage and automotive. We are harnessing the power of influencers to win hearts, catch eyes and reinvent advertising as we know it. Billion Dollar Boy embraces equality, diversity and inclusion and will seek to promote these benefits in all of our business activities. A part of what we offer at BDB is a considerate suite of competitive benefits, which will be discussed with you throughout the interview process

title: IT Manager - Client Services EMEA
job_description: Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.  We are thrilled to extend to you the opportunity to lead our IT Client Services team as the IT Manager for our EMEA region, based out of our London office. Our objective is to provide Snowflake employees and partners with exceptional experiences, and with your expertise, we can enhance our IT Service Management to achieve this goal. As Manager, you will develop a strategy that not only provides outstanding support to Snowflake employees but also boosts productivity and reduces costs. You will oversee a team of IT operations support members across multiple locations in EMEA and collaborate closely with other operational teams worldwide. As we continue to expand rapidly, we are seeking someone with exceptional organizational skills, a strong focus on execution, and self-motivation. If you are passionate about problem-solving and seeing projects through to successful completion, this position is perfect for you. Our team is characterized by positivity and optimism, and we would be thrilled to have you join us. This is an onsite position, and we are excited to welcome you to our London office.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Create a collaborative and supportive environment for the support team, serving as a leader not only by mentorship but also by rolling up your sleeves and supporting the team as necessary. Coach, mentor, and lead a team of support personnel to foster a performance-based team that delivers high customer value and satisfaction. Manage IT communication and training activities for Snowflake employees, internal IT staff, and outsource partners. Identify, recommend, develop, and implement end-user training programs. Collaborate with business partners to ensure smooth IT onboarding and offboarding of Snowflake employees. Develop and manage the team to meet and exceed established incident resolution, service request fulfillment expectations, and timeframes internally and for the Managed Service Provider (MSP) providing L1 Support. Work with business owners and IT staff to analyze and resolve problems associated with technical issues, and recommend solutions for new needs. Work with software and hardware vendors for support when necessary to resolve complex problems. Evangelize the value of IT to the business by developing relationships with key stakeholders, providing management with key metrics, and increasing user adoption of technology. Collaborate with local business leaders and IT management to align with Snowflake objectives around IT-recommended business solutions for their issues. Manage all IT escalations and enhance the user experience for EMEA locations with a positive global impact. Frequent syncs with the global leadership team outside of normal local hours.    REQUIREMENTS:  Minimum of 5 years experience in IT Client Services management field Should have relevant experience supporting heavy macOS users based on SAAS applications such as Google Workspace, and Zoom behind OKTA Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, or engineering, or equivalent work experience Strong subject matter expertise and experience with IT Service Management tools, such as ServiceNow Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple problems and issues, with excellent organizational skills, a teamwork approach to work, and the ability to collaborate with peers to solve problems Excellent team management, coaching, and mentoring skills Experience leading a team of IT professionals in a service desk, client services environment, or other IT support function Excellent oral and written communication skills, with strong interpersonal skills Highly organized with strong project management skills; PMP certification is a plus Ability to identify, recruit, and retain high-performing staff Ability to effectively deal with assignments that require strategic thinking Experience with collaborating with various vendors ITIL certification and ServiceNow experience is highly desirable Availability to travel to national and international locations as needed to support sites within Europe - please note that this role is based out of our London office

title: IT Manager - Systems Accountant
job_description: About The Role  The IT Manager - Systems Accountant is a newly established position within the Booker IT team. In this role, the individual will oversee the delivery of the change and compliance program agenda across the Booker Group Finance teams. Additionally, they will play a crucial role in supporting and delivering effective, secure, and efficient systems.  Reporting to the IT Finance Team Manager, the new role involves steering the successful execution of our SAP system roadmap. This includes overseeing the end-to-end life cycle of projects with varying complexity and criticality. These initiatives span from supporting Finance reporting, ongoing departmental continuous improvement programs, and delivering new functionality that aligns with our Health/Safety/Legal, Customer Satisfaction, and Cash Profit agenda.  A key focus of this role will be to lead the implementation of new technologies aimed at driving greater segregation of duties compliance. Additionally, the incumbent will be responsible for implementing new controls to enhance our ICFR audit processes.  Applicants for this position should possess knowledge of SAP modules such as Financial Accounting (FI) and Controlling (CO).  Strong analytical abilities are essential for configuring and optimising financial processes, while a profound understanding of financial reporting standards is necessary. Success in this role relies on effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams. Additionally, troubleshooting experience is valuable for upholding system integrity and ensuring smooth financial operations.  This role can be based in either our Eccles or Watford office, and is offered with a car allowance.   Main Responsibilities  Oversee the delivery of the change and compliance program across the finance teamsWork proactively with stakeholders to improve processes and maximise system asset utilization.Work to deliver system improvements and projects to support the company's growth plans and customer satisfaction.Work to identify project issues that will or are impacting systems stability, availability, and functionality, and then work promptly and proactively to mitigate and resolve such issues.Work to reliably and efficiently produce timely and accurate project management documentation.Manage the allocation of internal and external IT development and testing resource.  You will need  In-depth understanding of financial reporting standards to ensure compliance and precision in financial documentation.Strong investigative skills to identify and address discrepancies and anomalies in financial information.Demonstrated expertise in utilising SAP systems, with a focus on Financial Accounting (FI) and Controlling (CO) modules.Building the appropriate business justification and benefits cases to support the change programme.Ability to translate the Finance team’s business requirements into simple and easy-to-use system processes.A desire to affect changeExcellence in building positive relationships with our stakeholdersAbility to prioritise and organise projects to meet business needs, and an eye for detail.  What's in it for you  At Booker, along with being a great place to work and giving you an opportunity to get on in your career, we also offer the following fantastic package of benefits:  A Booker colleague card with 10% off purchases at Booker and double discount events up to three times a year.After 3 months service, a Tesco colleague discount card with 10% increasing to 15% off most purchases at Tesco for a 4 day period after every four-weekly pay day, ie. thirteen times a year. In addition to 10% off at Tesco Cafe and 20% off all F&F purchases.10% off pay monthly & SIM only deals with Tesco Mobile for yourself, along with further great deals through-out the year.Up to 30% off car, pet and home insurance at Tesco bank. Terms and conditions apply.Free eye test when you spend £50 or more. You can also save 30% when you spend £50 or more on glasses, prescription sunglasses and contact lenses.50% off health checks at Tesco Pharmacy.Exclusive access to discounted RAC breakdown cover ratesAn exclusive deals and discounts website saving you money on everyday purchases including a cycle to work scheme.After 3 months service, you can join our annual Save As You Earn share scheme which allows you to buy Tesco shares in the future at a discount.Retirement savings plan (pension) - save up to 5% and Booker will match your contribution.Life Assurance - You are covered for death in service life cover of up to three times annual payHealth and Wellbeing support and resources including our 24/7, confidential Employee Assistance Programme for you and your family.A great holiday package

title: IT Manager Salesforce
job_description: Description:  At Johnson & Johnson Vision (JJV), we have a bold ambition: to change the trajectory of eye health. That’s why, through our operating companies, we’ve developed solutions for every stage of life—to help people see better, connect better and live better. We partner with eye care professionals to provide some of the world’s leading products and technologies to address refractive error, cataracts, dry eye, and beyond. We are committed to using our reach and size for good and strive to put quality eye care within reach of everyone, everywhere. Visit us at www.jjvision.com. Follow @JNJVision on Twitter and Johnson & Johnson Vision on LinkedIn.  JJV is recruiting for an IT Manager Salesforce to join our Business Technology Solutions team supporting our Vision Care business in the EMA region. This position is located in Pinewood, UK.  This role will have regional accountabilities for EMA, responsible for the Salesforce Platform working within the HPT model as the IT Manager Salesforce. As an IT Manager Salesforce, you will be accountable for all aspects of our global Salesforce instance including platform and capability roadmap, design governance, licensing, reliability, and leading development teams to delivery new solutions that enable user experience and deliver outcomes. The TPM will also have responsibility for partnering closely with business and solution leads to help drive programs that are integrated into the Salesforce platform or have touchpoints to the sales force effectiveness space.  Position Description:  Partner with the Business Product Owner and commercial leaders to define Salesforce product strategy, roadmaps, business cases and outcomes (OKRs, KPIs)Translate business strategy to Salesforce solutions and have accountability for the solutions and their outcomes including related measures, metrics, and dashboardsConduct experiments to test the real-world success of proposed solutions.Estimate development and effort levels to prioritize requirements and align IT capacity with top Salesforce business priorities.Lead teams and deliver projects aligned to the Salesforce platform vision, goals and encouraged outcomes. Define and ensure adherence to J&J processes and standards.Proactively partner with solution leads, technology services and other regional and global enterprise architects to design scalable, flexible and supportable technical systems that add business value and are aligned with the JJV technology strategy as well as enterprise patterns and standards. Partner with technology services, product lines, vendors, and other enterprise architects within the larger global J&J organization to influence enterprise technology strategies and identify opportunities for bi-directional leverage across sectors and business units.  Qualifications:  8 years of equivalent business or technology experience is required.8 years of hands-on experience in Digital Product related technology positions including multi-market deployments of Salesforce.com and experience designing and delivering API first architectures centered on mobile and web engagement solutions. - RequiredExperience and operational understanding of SalesForce.com and it’s product offerings and capabilities as well as other commercial effectiveness platforms and architecture principles. - RequiredExperience in running delivery of Agile projects with globally diverse teams. Completion of several full Salesforce.com IT projects from initiation, delivery to support required.Experience building a digital ecosystem, including user applications, solution and system architecture and integrations and related data strategy and analytical capabilities. The ability to quickly learn the business and complex processes, to understand and work across multiple business domains, and strong communication and critical thinking skills.Experience leading technical conversations, workshops and workstreams to consensus/conclusions/actionsExperience documenting user/system requirements and user acceptance testing scripts.Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate business requirements, direction, and initiatives, including ability to balance requirements from an enterprise, sector and franchise/region level.Strong ability to build and maintain relationships at various levels, both inside and outside an organization.Ability to stay organized and manage multiple priorities with professionalism.Proficiency in creating effective and engaging Microsoft Power Point presentations. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel in aggregating, summarizing and presenting data. Familiarity with various IT programming languages and techniques, database platforms, ETL tools, cloud based architectures and mobility platform solutions.  Preferred:  Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   Salesforce.com Certified Administrator or ConsultantFamiliarity or experience working with Salesforce Marketing CloudKnowledge of healthcare processes, data and terminology.Experience with system development lifecycle methodology.Experience working in a multi-functional or cross-geographic context.Experience working in a Shared Services IT Operating model where development and support services are provided by shared services organizations that support multiple functional and organizational units.An opportunity to be part of a global market leader. A dynamic and inspiring working environment. Many opportunities to work on challenging projects and assignments. An opportunity to participate in employee engagement activities on a voluntary basis based on individual preference. Experience working in regulated environment (e.g. GxP, HIPAA, GDPR …).Possibilities for further personal as well as professional development. Employee benefits are regulated by an internal policy that contains full details regarding the entitlement and conditions for the benefits.We are committed to providing an inclusive and equitable work environment and promoting the wellbeing of all employees. Applicants who are interested in the following flexible work arrangements are welcome to apply and we’d be happy to actively discuss this option with you

title: IT Manager
job_description: As IT Manager, I will fully comprehend the vision of Six Senses to help people reconnect with themselves, others and the world around them and our values of local sensitivity and global sensibility, crafted experiences, emotional hospitality, responsible and caring, fun and quirky and pioneering wellness.  Sustainability, Wellness and Out of the Ordinary experiences are at the core of everything we do at Six Senses. I will safeguard these pillars and its strategic planning and development and ensure all directives, practices and initiatives are implemented, embraced, adopted within the hotel.  Duties and Responsibilities:  As IT Manager, I will assume full responsibility for the efficient operation of the IT department to provide exceptional products and services within brand operating standards.  The duties and responsibilities will include:  Diagnose Hardware and software problems and replace defective components and perform data backups and disaster recovery operations; maintain, administer computer networks and related computing environments including computer hardware, systems software, applications software, and all configurations. Plan, coordinate, and implement network security measures to protect data, software, and hardware; operate master consoles to monitor the performance of computer systems and networks, and to coordinate computer network access and use. Ensure to perform routine network startup and shutdown procedures and maintain control records. Design, configure, and test computer hardware, networking software and operating system software.Recommend changes to improve systems and network configurations and determine hardware or software requirements related to such changes. Confer with network users about how to solve existing system problems. title: IT Manager
job_description: Smarter Grid Solutions is a pioneering software technology company working at the intersection of clean energy, advanced digital technology, and power systems. We are a team of electrical engineers, software developers, analytics & consulting experts and much more working on the transformation of tomorrow’s electric grid – to become cleaner, more efficient, and more sustainable. SGS are seeking an experienced and highly motivated IT Manager to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing our information technology infrastructure, managing the IT team, and ensuring our systems and applications are robust and reliable.   Responsibilities:  Manage and maintain our company's IT infrastructure, including hardware, software, and networks Manage and motivate a team of IT professionals, ensuring they have the necessary resources and training to succeed Develop and implement IT policies and procedures to ensure the security and integrity of our systems and data Evaluate and implement new technologies to improve our business processes and enhance our productivity Identify and manage IT risks and issues, and develop contingency plans to mitigate them Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards, such as GDPR and ISO 27001 Collaborate with other departments to identify and address IT-related business needs and opportunities Manage the IT budget and negotiate contracts with vendors and service providers  Requirements  Proven experience as an IT Manager or similar role in an SME environment Excellent knowledge of IT systems, networks, and infrastructure Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team Experience in developing and implementing IT policies and procedures Knowledge of data protection and information security regulations, such as GDPR and ISO 27001 Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with colleagues at all levels Ability to manage budgets and negotiate contracts with vendors and service providers  Benefits Competitive salary, dependent upon experience 33 days holiday5% matched Employer pension schemeUp to 5% Gainshare bonus per annumPrivate Medical Insurance through VitalityLife Cover (3x)CycleschemeHybrid Working Opportunities Smarter Grid Solutions is proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer. We are committed to working in an environment that is free from all types of discrimination, is inclusive and empowers our people to bring their whole self to work and reach their full potential. At Smarter Grid Solutions, we recognise that we can grow and thrive with a diverse team of people. We hire great people from a variety of backgrounds not just because it is the right thing to do, but because it makes our Company stronger. We are committed to providing reasonable support or adjustments during our recruitment process. If you need support, please reach out to recruitment@smartergridsolutions.com.Should your application be successful, we will conduct relevant employment checks before you join us too

title: Helpdesk Manager
job_description: Are you currently a Service Desk Manager, looking for the next step in your career? Do you want to work in a rewarding and dynamic environment? If so, this might be the role for you! We have an amazing opportunity within MMR as we are looking to expand our team with our new Helpdesk Manager, contributing to the support of our global business. Joining a vibrant and collaborative IT team, this role would suit someone who has previous experience within a similar role and is looking for the next step. This is a fantastic opportunity for those who seek a dynamic and thriving work environment. Be part of something extraordinary at MMR! A bit about us:MMR is an independent, global consumer and sensory research agency specialising in food, drink, personal and household care research. We are industry leaders, guiding best in class innovation for our clients - partnering with over 50% of the top 100 global food and drink brands.Our team of over 800 highly engaged, multi-disciplined employees are primarily dynamic research professionals, sensory experts and data scientists. We're a diverse bunch, with backgrounds in R&D, insight, marketing, sensory science, data sciences and psychology. We also boast a true global reach with offices in Wallingford (near Oxford), London, New York, Shanghai, Singapore, Mumbai, Sao Paulo, Cali (Colombia), Bangkok and Durban. What makes MMR special?We are a "people first" company that prides itself on collaboration, honesty and mutual trust. Don't take our word for it though, check us out on Glassdoor. You'll see we're currently rated at 4.8 out of 5 as an employer destination and a massive 97% of our employees would recommend working for us to a friend. Add to that 99% of our people approve of our CEO and you a general feel of what it means to be part of the MMR family.Main ResponsibilitiesSuccessfully lead & manage the helpdesk team, driving a culture of service excellence and continuous improvement through: Line management of technical and team lead staff members, including 1-2-1's, annual reviews, development, and succession planning.Defining, reporting on, and improving performance in terms of team and individual KPIs.Ownership of P1 tickets and driving to resolution ensuring the customer kept always informed, ensuring SLA's and customer expectations are met.Working with the Project team / Sysadmin Team to transition projects to Internal support services.Providing Escalation point to Service Desk Engineer, providing 2nd/3rd line support before escalation of the ticket to Sysadmin / Dev team.Managing recruitment of technicians necessary to run a successful service desk effectively.Proactively report service desk metrics, successes and areas requiring attention to the senior management teamDeliver continuous service improvement objectives set by the senior management team.Build and maintain exceptional relationships with customers based on integrity.Implement a customer satisfaction review process and ensure that feedback is reviewed and responded to in all instances where low satisfaction is reported.Key point of contact internally for Helpdesk team. Essential support when you need it 24/7 365 daysManaging relationships with external vendors and service providers. Negotiation skills for optimal service levels and pricing.Strategic Thinking Alignment of helpdesk goals with overall business objectives and IT strategy. Strategic planning for anticipating future support needs and technology trends.Ownership of New Starter and Leaver processOwnership of Asset Management RequirementsIn order to excel in this role, you must demonstrate competency in key behavioural and technical skills:BehaviouralSelf-Starter - You must be someone who has perpetual motivation for this industry. There is always lots to learn and do, you must be able to show a keen interest in progressing with tasks at a good speed and be actively seeking things that needs to be addressed within your remit.Self-Management - Can switch between different tasks according to business needs, coping with changing priorities and keeping others informed of possible issues.Communication - Communicates and explains clearly, professionally, and concisely, both verbally and in writing.Teamwork - Maintains open and honest relationships with colleagues building trust and confidence.Client Service - Communicates clearly with the client, taking time to keep them informed and being responsive to their requests. Building the client's trust and confidence in MMR to deliver a high-quality service.Learning and Improving - Aims to learn as much as possible and take up opportunities for new experiences. Consolidates learning in a structured way.Developing others - Ensuring team are clear on expectations and priorities and supported to deliver on their goals. Key Technical SkillsProven experience as a Service Desk Manager with a global team focus.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to make well-informed decisions during critical incidents.Hands-on experience supporting hardware, software, and infrastructure, primarily in a Microsoft stack.Proficiency in Microsoft 365, Azure, Office, and Windows 10/11 administration.Solid experience with Windows Server 2012+, Active Directory / Azure AD, and networking.In-depth understanding of Cyber Security principles, concepts, and technologies.Familiarity with MSP tools (PSA, RMM), remote access, technical documentation, disaster recovery, and backup technologies.Previous experience implementing new service procedures. Additional SkillsKnowledge of risk assessment and management for proactive issue identification and mitigation.Strong documentation skills for maintaining accurate records. Clear and concise communication through documentation for knowledge transfer.Skills in budget management, resource allocation, and cost control for the helpdesk function.Experience in designing and implementing training programs. Commitment to the professional development of the helpdesk staff

title: IT Manager - Infrastructure & Cybersecurity
job_description: Company Description: J. Barbour & Sons Ltd founded in 1894 is a British lifestyle brand, home to the iconic Wax jacket. We design, manufacture and market stylish functional clothing and footwear for men, women and children inspired by the unique values of the British countryside. We are the proud holder of Royal warrants and remain true to our core values as a fifth-generation family business. Barbour is sold in over 40 countries worldwide, including Europe, the US and Japan but we have our headquarters and roots firmly located in the North East of England. Position Overview: We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced leader in IT infrastructure and cybersecurity to join our growing IT team. A robust, scalable, and secure infrastructure is critical to our business as it provides a platform for our Users, systems, wholesale trading partners and retail outlets to trade. Barbour is going through an exciting period of change, as we expand our global operations and continue to focus on our cybersecurity program.The role will form an integral part of the IT leadership team, taking primary responsibility for driving our strategic direction across all aspects of infrastructure including our global network, computer and network rooms, on-premise systems, cloud services and retail outlets.The combination of strategic direction, architecture and technical expertise, adaptability, hands-on leadership, and disciplined delivery will be critical success factors, although, it is expected this role will be significantly hands-on. Alongside this, an ability to communicate to business management, lead the infrastructure architectural decisions within the enterprise architecture and lead a multi-skilled team will all be crucial abilities. Expertise in cybersecurity tools and solid experience leading a cybersecurity policy and program are essential. Main Duties and Responsibilities: Lead and define the infrastructure & Cyber security strategies and solution governance for the global Barbour business.Define the “to-be” infrastructure architecture, which must be robust, scalable, and adaptable to support operational needs.Key member of the Enterprise Architecture Committee and responsible for defining the as-is and to-be infrastructure chapter of the EA and governing change.Collaborate with stakeholders, business Users, project managers, other IT team members and third parties.Leads the approach, design, security, documentation, and implementation of infrastructure solutions, considering business requirements, constraints, and ongoing supportability.Product Manager for all any relevant infrastructure solutions (SharePoint, Office 365)Responsibility for the deliveries of the infrastructure team, system integrators, infrastructure service providers and telecoms providers.Plan and manage the portfolio of infrastructure projects and initiatives.Provide coaching and leadership to members of the infrastructure team, plan and manage their development, training, and performance.Provide advice and guidance to the IT team and associated stakeholders around infrastructure solution decisions.Represent Barbour in external projects with customers and suppliers.Responsible for the security and availability of network rooms and computer rooms with the support of local facility management.Ensure all business-critical infrastructure is monitored for security and availability.Ensure all databases are secure, highly available, continuously patched and regularly upgraded and performance tuned.Develop, periodically update, and get approval for the Cybersecurity and IT Acceptable Use policies and ensure all technology is compliant and risks documented and understood.Continuously monitor cyber risks, ensuring vulnerabilities and cyber events are identified and mitigated.Set, approve, and closely monitor firewall policy and activity.Research, develop and deploy cybersecurity technical standards to harden all hardware, operating systems, middleware, integrations, cloud technology, databases and applications and implement all required controls.Manage a schedule of internal and penetration testing and remediation are maintained to ensure PCI-DSS compliance is maintained and reported on and reduce cyber risk.Major incident manager for infrastructure and cybersecurity incidents, ensuring all stakeholders are continuously updated and incidents managed, and root causes identified and mitigated.Role of Business Relationship Manager for assigned business areas. DKIM, DMARK, SPF etc.Superior theory and hands-on experience of network, internet, and firewall technologiesVMware and storage systemsExcellent communication and stakeholder management skillsA confident and pragmatic technology leaderStrong organisational leadership skills, with a desire to coach and build capabilities and ways of working best practices across a team.Excellent verbal and written communication skills to build strong relationships across business functions.Ability to build relationships and influence at a senior management level.Experience of IT leadership role, setting tone, expectation, and direction for teamRetail systems experience and working environment preferable but not essential. title: IT Manager – Project Applications
job_description: Contract Type  Permanent   Work pattern  Full time   Position Location  Newcastle, United Kingdom   Job Description   Do you want to work for a company whose purpose is to improve society by considering social outcomes, and to transform businesses, communities, and opportunities for its employees?   At Mott MacDonald we are committed to our employees and their growth, and our People Program is our investment in your success. If you join Mott MacDonald there will be opportunities for you to progress to specialist IT roles in applications management, software development, networking, cloud technologies or security.  The Project Information and Engineering applications Manager is responsible for overseeing the support for Mott MacDonald’s project information platforms and engineering applications. Working as part of the global Project Systems Management team within the IT department, the Manager will oversee the support of existing technology and workflows as well as lead in the implementation of emerging technologies. This role will assist with management of resources, maintenance regimes, and support escalations of applications from vendors such as Autodesk, Bentley, and Tekla.   Team Management   Manage a team of specialist for Project Information Platforms and Engineering applications.Ensure the administration of Project Information environments, Configuration of templates and data sources. Ensure license compliance and management processes are in place. Oversee the development of workflows/rules for engineering applications to meet project and business requirements.Research and Development of new services. Ensure processes are in place for the implementation of upgrades and migration to future application versions and services.    IT Service Delivery & Operations.   Oversee and collaborate with Application Packaging, Asset Management and Service Owners to deliver and deploy applications on a global scale. Act as a point of contact for related issues and implement service improvements to continually improve the service. Act as an escalation point for issues raised with 3rd party vendors on incident escalation and problem management. Ensure application testing through user acceptance testing is completed satisfactorily. Ensure all related applications are kept up-to-date on the IT Service Catalogue. Ensure Knowledge based articles are created and maintained to the correct technical standard. Provide written documentation, updates, and root cause analysis on incidents, and resolutions. Ensure systems are Monitored to ensure optimum service availability. Participate in projects to implement new service offerings, acting as Project Manager on smaller elements of work. Ensure all systems are Monitored and maintain the system performance.    Key Performance Indicators   Business satisfaction SLA attainment of Engineering Information Services Continual service improvement metrics Documented adherence to global standards and KPI’s Demonstrate value of technology to business KPI’s   Candidate Specification   Essential   Knowledge and Experience   Demonstrable experience in a similar senior IT role. Excellent working understanding of information technology and its application to business issues. Knowledge of business operations and processes in a large multinational or global organization. Demonstrable experience of building strong and productive relationships with key business customers. Experience facilitating change management involving business processes and organizational change. Demonstrated knowledge of core business processes, operations, and strategic use of technology to optimize business objectives. Proven experience facilitating identification of creative solutions, conducting business analysis, and verifying business requirements.    Desirable   Qualifications & Education   Experience of managing multi-disciplined diverse teams. Experience of delivering technical support in an engineering environment. Experience of the process of deploying applications to multiple office in a global environment. title: IT Help Desk Technician
job_description: Gravity Global is the world’s most awarded marketing consultancy specialising in brands operating in complex markets. Led by strategy, innovation, technology, data and creativity, we create brand-and-demand marketing programmes that drive transformational growth for our clients. With 14 wholly owned offices across the US, Europe, and APAC, you can develop a truly global career in a rapidly scaling organisation. title: Senior IT Manager - eCommerce & Content Management
job_description: Canon is changing and so are the markets we supply and the customers we serve. We are on a journey of transition to being a truly customer centric company bringing new services and solutions to our customer communities. To support us on this journey, our Senior IT Manager – eCommerce & Content is responsible to deliver complex solutions for integrated software landscapes across the e-Commerce & Content domain. These include technologies such as Oracle ATG, OCC and the integrated e2e business landscape (e.g. ERP, Warehousing, payment, BPM layer) and associated SaaS supporting applications in the e-Commerce / Content Management domain.  This role will be part of the Solution & Adoption department, who is responsible for application delivery & application operations for the Canon EMEA region. Furthermore, this role requires operations and delivery excellence capabilities with strong people management skills.  Role overview this role is internally known as Principal Solution & Adoption Consultant.  What We Give  With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.  As a Senior IT Manager – eCommerce & Content Management, you will  Provide the e-Commerce and content management domain with innovative, best fitting end-to-end process/IT solutions based on an expert understanding of both business processes and technology capabilities.Lead cross organizational process/IT change programs from concept to successful end-to-end implementation, incl. stakeholder management on MT level and management of external service providers.Act as a trusted advisor, cross organizational, on middle and senior management level in all matters of process/IT.Manage, coach and lead a team of direct reports, less experienced colleagues (internal and external) and managing external partners on excellent solutions and delivery.  Broader responsibilities include accountability/responsibility for  Operational stability of the eCommerce & Content Management domainBeing the single point of contact towards business stakeholders in eCommerce & Content Management for operations and project escalationsEnsuring maximum efficiency of the existing team who focus on AM activitiesEnsuring effective resource and capacity planning across different IT initiativesOverseeing the management of operational budgets including Service Partner teams and software renewals  What we ask  As a Senior IT Manager – eCommerce & Content Management you will need  A Bachelor or Master degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field.Experience in IT Delivery , including eCommerce and/or Content Management experience managing large process / IT programs with an excellent track record.Experience of managing offshore teamsStrong background in defining solutions for integrated enterprise software landscape with eCommerce platforms such as Oracle ATG and OCC, Salesforce.com (SaaS), IBM WebSphere or other integration tools.Extensive experience in either B2C and/or B2B customer experiences.Excellent Project Management skills.Exceptional problem solving and sound decision making capabilities, recognized by alternative solutions, and confident, accurate, decision-making coupled with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Strong stakeholder & people management skills  You will need  Is business outcome drivenIs courageous and has convictionEnsures delivery of the outcomeIs customer orientedInnovates by building on skills & experienceIs inspirational and motivationalBuilds trust based relationshipsDevelops and coaches others  Further Information  Base pay – £84,498 – £104,319Bonus (10%) – A discretionary bonus scheme that rewards you as you help us achieve our goals.Learning & Development – As a Company that encourages continuous learning you will always have resources and support available.Work & Home Life Balance – We support with a minimum of 25 days holiday per year, holiday purchase and a flexible working policy.Diversity – We are an organization that delivers on a global scale, striving to create a diverse and empowered workforce that reflects the communities we serve.Health & Wellbeing – Free private healthcare, an Employee Assistance Programme, partnership with Mental Health First Aid UK with a network of mental health champions and discounted rates to Nuffield Health Gym.Employee discount – Up to 38% off products from our Canon store.Some other Benefits – Generous Pension, Canon Awards, Discount cards, Cycle to Work scheme, Season ticket loans and charity volunteer days  Canon champions hybrid working with and a flexible working policy. You will be part of an energetic and innovative environment with more than 50 different nationalities! Lastly you’ll find that Canon encourages continuous Learning and Development with a wide range of resources and support available on demand.  Does this seem like a great fit for your career expectations? We're excited to hear from you! Even if you don't meet all the qualifications we still encourage you to apply. At Canon we have a clear vision to be committed to creating a more inclusive and equitable culture where employees are valued and can thrive personally and professionally. title: Principal IT Desktop Engineer
job_description: Our Principal IT Desktop Engineer is responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of desktop infrastructure and end user support. To provide a high level of technical expertise, leadership, and collaboration in ensuring smooth and efficient operations of desktop systems and applications used by employees.  Key Accountabilities  Design, implement, and continuously improve the organization's desktop infrastructure, including hardware, operating systems, software applications, and end-user devices. Ensure the infrastructure is efficient, secure, and aligned with business needs.Serve as a subject matter expert in desktop engineering, staying up to date with emerging technologies and industry trends. Provide technical leadership and guidance to the IT team, recommending best practices, solutions, and innovative approaches to enhance the desktop environment.Act as the highest escalation point for complex technical issues related to desktops and end-user devices. Provide advanced troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and issue resolution to ensure a high level of end-user satisfaction and minimal downtime.Develop and implement desktop security measures and policies, ensuring compliance with company security standards and industry regulations. Monitor security vulnerabilities, conduct risk assessments, and perform regular security audits to maintain a secure desktop environment.Establish and maintain relationships with hardware and software vendors. Manage deployment, and lifecycle management of desktop-related assets, ensuring optimal utilization of resources and adherence to budgetary constraints.Identify and implement improvements to desktop engineering processes, tools, and technologies to enhance efficiency, productivity, and user experience. Stay informed about industry trends and evaluate new solutions to drive innovation in the desktop environment.Maintain accurate documentation of desktop infrastructure, configurations, policies, and procedures. Create and update technical documentation, user guides, and knowledge base articles to facilitate efficient problem-solving and knowledge sharing among team members and end-users.  Knowledge And Experience  Proven experience in desktop engineering, systems administration, or a similar role.Strong technical knowledge of desktop operating systems (e.g., Windows, macOS), hardware, software applications, and end-user devices.Experience with desktop management tools (e.g., SCCM, JAMF, Microsoft Intune) and endpoint security solutions.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Leadership abilities with experience in managing teams, setting priorities, and delivering results.Knowledge of ITIL principles and IT service management processes is a plus.Several years of experience in desktop engineering, end-user computing, or a similar role, working with enterprise-scale desktop infrastructure and managing many desktop devices.Proven track record of providing advanced technical support and issue resolution to end-users, including troubleshooting hardware and software problems, performing root cause analysis, and delivering exceptional customer service.Experience in designing and implementing desktop infrastructure projects, such as desktop hardware refreshes, operating system upgrades, software deployments, or endpoint security enhancements.Previous leadership experience or demonstrated abilities in providing technical leadership, coordinating with cross-functional teams, managing vendor relationships, and effectively communicating technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Education  College/University degree in a relevant technical area (Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering) or equivalent experience

title: IT Manager - WMS
job_description: Be An Essential Part Of Everyday Life  Location: Milton Keynes (Remote) - MK9 1EA  DHL is the global leader in Supply Chain management and we keep the world moving. Our expert teams work together to deliver for our customers across a range of industries including retail, automotive, healthcare and more, so they can deliver to their customers.  At DHL, IT is more than just systems, servers and making sure that each and every one of us has the bits, bytes and bobs needed for our jobs. IT is the nerve system of Supply Chain – we connect different parts of our organisation with each other and to customers, translating business needs into solutions across the globe.  When customers and business partners think of IT, we are strategic partners capable of enacting value-adding change through standardisation, differentiation and innovation.  What about your role?  As the IT Manager - WMS (Warehouse Management Systems) you will be accountable for completing the analysis of business requirements through process mapping & translating these into a detailed configuration of strategic products while also providing SME support in terms of technical changes to system solutions to meet the business needs. You will carry out standard configuration requests and support with any new go-live projects. You will also be responsible for ensuring good maintenance of system templates to help streamline future on boarding projects.  As a IT Manager-WMS your key accountabilities and responsibilities will include the following:   Demonstrate advanced proficiency in Blue Yonder WMS, encompassing system configuration, optimization, and troubleshooting.Utilise SQL language skills for data analysis, extraction, and manipulation within the WMS environment.Develop and optimise SQL queries to enhance and support reporting requirements and performanceKnowledge of integration, with the ability to read and interpret MSD (Mapping Specification Document).Ensure seamless communication and data exchange between WMS and integration systemsPlay a key role in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) management, collaborating with stakeholders to validate system changes.Develop and execute test plans, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of WMS configurations.Lead WMS implementation projects, ensuring a smooth transition from planning to execution.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet project timelines and deliverables.Act as the primary point of contact for customers, addressing inquiries, providing technical support, and ensuring overall customer satisfaction.Effectively communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholdersDocument and analyse business requirements, translating them into actionable WMS configurations.Maintain comprehensive documentation including operation and system process maps to facilitate future system enhancements and modifications.Implement robust change management processes to assess, approve, and deploy modifications to the WMS.Manage patch releases program across Technology estate. Minimise disruption to operations during system changes.Actively participate in incident management to support resolution and root cause analyses.Proactively managed WMS CI and cost reduction activitiesBuild and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.Collaborate with various departments to align IT WMS strategies with overall business objectives.Develop and conduct training programs for super users, ensuring a proficient and knowledgeable user base.Foster a culture of continuous learning and skill development within the organisation.   What are the requirements?   Basic Blue Yonder WMS configuration knowledgeExposure to solution configurationDesirable: Blue Yonder WMS configuration Training (Int/Ext)Desirable: intermediate SQL proficiency, Prince 2, Change management qualification.Desirable: ITIL qualification    Why choose DHL Supply Chain?  As well as competitive pay rates, once you have completed your probation you will be entitled to an award-winning range of benefits to improve your wellbeing both at work and at home, including discount vouchers for restaurants, cinemas, retail outlets, healthcare and much more:   Physical Health – A free confidential 24/7 GP Service, Gym discounts, Cycle to work schemeFinancial Health – Enhanced Pension scheme, affordable loans, free mortgage advice and hundreds of retail/lifestyle discountsSocial Health – Volunteering, mentoring and fundraising opportunities   What about career development?  We take every employee's career seriously and believe in realising their full potential. We have dedicated learning and development programmes that are open to every employee and an open working culture where everyone's voice is heard, so you can shape your future career path at DHL Supply Chain.  What will you need to do next?  If you meet the requirements for this role and are looking for your next career move, submit your application to us along with an up to date CV or covering letter.  We look forward to hearing from you, and hopefully welcoming you to our team.  Our approach to Diversity and Inclusion  As a global company, we see the diversity of our employees as a genuine strength. A strength that we will only really leverage if we ensure that our employees sincerely feel that they can bring their true selves to work every day.  We're committed to attracting the best possible person for every vacancy irrespective of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will ensure that all our resourcing activities are fair, transparent and consistent across the organisatio
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: IT Manager
job_description: ABOUT USCallaway Golf Europe Ltd is a leader in total performance, premium golf equipment and active lifestyle products while also being a great place to work! We are passionate and push the limits of innovation. We dare to be great while acting with integrity and respect. We stay hungry, yet humble. All while having fun and making golf enjoyable for everyone! Our company is a blend of experience and diverse backgrounds, and our leaders have a strong history of building and selling successful initiatives. We are working to build a truly ground breaking company, and we want top-notch people to join us in that mission. The position leads an inhouse team of 4, supporting two sites (Chessington office and Swindon distribution centre), company IT users across 15 countries and works closely with the global IT team. The role is pivotal in the provision, deployment and management of technology solutions deployed at these sites. Jira platform for tracking and escalation purposesCollaborate with global IT peers and external suppliers on incidents, projects and tasksLead communications to business on behalf of IT Dept.Lead weekly team meeting ensuring Service Desk standards and issue ownership are understood and maintainedManage local hardware procurement (HP, Lenovo, Apple desktops, HP & Zebra print, Zebra/Motorola RF FortiGate / MPLS-connected networkManage internal Wi-Fi and internet connectivity at both UK sites, engaging company or service provider support where necessaryDeploy, manage and support on-premise SOPsTelephonyAdminister and support Cisco Webex telephony solution for all users and contact centre agents, engaging 3rd party providers as necessaryManage mobile telephony needs of UK business including hardware procurement and contract managementIT SecurityWork collaboratively with Global IT Security, HR team and all business users to maintain security of company network, endpoints and dataProject ManagementCreate project plans and manage projects initiated locally and via other business unitsFinancial ManagementManage departmental budget and capex planning, providing best-cost solutions and reliable forecastsTeam LeadershipExperienced, hands-on IT leader with a strong record of service delivery and customer satisfactionRecruit, train, inspire, motivate and mentor staff
